info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 6:00PM CDT until June 18 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following counties, Cook and Will.
* WHEN...Until 815 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 557 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain continuing due to nearly stationary showers. Rainfall rates up to 1-2 inches per hour have been observed near Plainfield and Romeoville. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen so far near Plainfield. - Rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible under the heaviest shower activity. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Chicago, Aurora, Joliet, Naperville, Hammond, Bolingbrook, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Oak Lawn, Romeoville, Plainfield, Calumet City, Woodridge, Chicago Heights, Roseland, Lansing, Oak Forest, Harvey, Lockport and New Lenox. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT THIS EVENING
